channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What’s at Stake as Netanyahu and Trump Meet in Washington
item.description: With the fighting in Iran over, President Trump is considering whether to pursue a new nuclear agreement with Tehran. He is also urging a new cease-fi...

item.title: Man Who Opened Fire on Texas Border Patrol Building Is Fatally Shot
item.description: The man opened fire on the building in McAllen, Texas, on Monday. A border patrol employee and two officers were injured, federal officials said.

item.title: Where Do Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Negotiations Stand?
item.description: Hamas wants a guarantee that negotiations will lead to a permanent end to the Gaza war.

item.title: The intended and unintended consequences of wolf reintroduction programs
item.description: Heath Druzin talks about what he learned about coexisting with wolves while making his podcast Howl, from Boise State Public Radio.

item.title: Can't sleep? Journalist Jennifer Senior says you're not alone in your insomnia
item.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning writer Jennifer Senior has had insomnia for 25 years. Her new piece in The Atlantic is about her often futile attempts to fall ...

item.title: Medical Societies Sue Kennedy and H.H.S. Over Vaccine Advice
item.description: New restrictions on Covid shots run counter to scientific evidence, the groups said.

item.title: Meet the woman who's reunited dozens of people with lost photos after the LA fires
item.description: We look at an Altadena resident who has made it her mission to help reunite keepsakes that survived the LA fires — photos, kids art, postcards — with ...

item.title: Floods are getting more dangerous around the country, not just in Texas
item.description: The deadly floods in Central Texas were caused by extremely heavy rain. Climate change is causing even more rain to fall during the heaviest storms.

item.title: Russian Minister Who Had Led Region Later Invaded by Ukraine Is Found Dead
item.description: Roman V. Starovoyt, the transport minister, had governed Russia’s western Kursk region before Ukrainian forces invaded in 2024 and occupied part of th...

item.title: When it comes to vaccines, how are pediatricians restoring trust?
item.description: NPR's Pien Huang speaks with pediatrician Alexandra Cvijanovich and Professor Jason L. Schwartz about trying to shore up trust about vaccines.

item.title: Trump Tells Japan and South Korea Their Tariff Rate: 25%
item.description: The tariffs on two of America’s closest allies would go into effect Aug. 1, unless the countries reach some kind of trade agreement with the United St...

item.title: What’s at Stake as Netanyahu and Trump Meet in Washington
item.description: With the fighting in Iran over, President Trump is considering whether to pursue a new nuclear agreement with Tehran. He is also urging a new cease-fi...

item.title: Iran Carries Out Mass Expulsion of Afghan Refugees
item.description: About 800,000 people have been deported to Afghanistan, a desperately poor country, under an Iranian campaign that accelerated sharply in June.

item.title: Russian Minister Who Had Led Region Later Invaded by Ukraine Is Found Dead
item.description: Roman V. Starovoyt, the transport minister, had governed Russia’s western Kursk region before Ukrainian forces invaded in 2024 and occupied part of th...

item.title: Trump Administration Ends Deportation Protections for Hondurans and Nicaraguans
item.description: The decision by the Homeland Security Department to end protections for migrants from those countries goes into effect in about two months.
